intro: Elleanthus grandiflorus, commonly known as the large-flowered elleanthus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It produces showy yellow flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and botanical collections.
